title: What are some pretty Chinese girls names that aren't overly used, but still understandable? I'm writing a story and really want to add a Chinese character. - Quora

response.answer_text: Conventionally, a Chinese name consists of one or two of any Chinese characters. Chinese names are very meaningful and subtle, especially to their parents. Giving baby an appropriate name is quite complicated. What name we should give is based on the characteristics of the girl in your story. I can only give you some examples: 姝(shu, peaceful), 妍(yan, beautiful), etc. Another problem is that you seem to write an English story so that you have no way to give an understandable Chinese name because Chinese is a tonal language and has a lot of homonyms. For example, “shu” represents four pronunciations with four different tones, covering almost 50 common used Chinese characters, among which four characters are often used as girls’ names: 姝(peaceful), 书 (book, if your character is in academic field), 淑 (virtually good), and 舒 (relaxed or comfortable, if your character sweet). I hope my answer helpful.

from what time period would your character be from? naming styles evolve over time, and if you are serious about your character, this is something to get right. and what is the character’s social/economical background? while there are no strict rich names/poor names, the parents’ education and income level typically determines the level of sophistication in their children’s names.
